abstract: Hundreds of members of indigenous communities in the Brazilian Amazon occupy construction site of the Belo Monte hydroelectric dam to protest its construction; move signals a change in strategy by indigenous groups, which have relied on legal challenges that have done little to dissuade the government to halt work on the dam.
snippet: About 300 members of local indigenous groups invaded the Belo Monte dam site in Pará, where a workers’ camp is being built for the dam.
lead_paragraph: About 300 members of local indigenous groups invaded the Belo Monte dam site in Pará, where a workers’ camp is being built for the dam.

headline.main: Brazilian Amazon Groups Invade Site of Dam Project
headline.print_headline: Brazilian Amazon Groups Invade Site of Dam Project
headline.seo: Brazilian Amazon Groups Try to Stop Dam Project
